HELP The form a is used before consonant sounds and the form an before vowel sounds. When saying abbreviations like 'FM' or 'UN', use a or an according to how the first letter is said. For example, F is a consonant, but begins with the sound /e/ and so you say: â—† an FM radio
U is a vowel but begins with /j/ and so you say: â—† a UN declaration
